caption: DO NOT order from this place if you want edible food.   Placed a decent sized order and the only edible item was the rice!  Zero flavor in anything for the most part and what you could taste had a foul, nasty aftertaste
They serve large dishes and for fair pricing. kind owner. I recommend this place.
Cant give it 5 stars because the same dish ordered 2 times did not taste or look the same.  Seems that the night chef did a better job.
(Translated by Google) good to eat  (Original) 好吃

It's places like this that make New York a food lovers paradise.  For years I had walked by, unimpressed with the storefront until someone told me how good the food was.  That was 7 years ago and I never go more than a month without ordering at least 4 of their dishes.  This is Sichuan cooking that will delight your taste buds.  Favorites are the Beef with cumin flavor, Dan Dan noodles, wonton in red oil, Guizhou Spicy Chicken, and their Wonton soup which is excellent.
Simply the best Sichuan food around. The family that runs the place are kind and extend quiet hospitality to everyone. Easily one of my family’s favorites!

Simply used google to find a local Chinese place (looked at the food pics too). This place is delicious. I got shrimp with lobster sauce and it’s the first time in all the years of me ordering I had to cut up my shrimp. They were delicious and huge! I was very impressed with them. One star lost cause I waited an hour and 45 minutes for delivery. Otherwise, highly recommend.
If you like Sichuan this is the best place in Brooklyn. All the classic dishes with the perfect amount of heat! Right by the 86th street exit so it’s easy to order take out.
Chicken was stringy to the point of being unchewable in spots. Soup was bland. Spicy dishes like Dan Dan noodles were not particularly spicy. They also overcharged me.
Excellent food, helpful employees, always fantastic character. They charge reasonable pricing and the food quality is fantastic. I recommend this place.
(Translated by Google) I think the food is very good, very good call  (Original) 我覺得食物很好，招呼也很好
Good place for Chinese takeaway
Love this place. The Chengdu Spicy Chicken is where it's at

Amazing food but staff is racist. There were two of us and not many people at the restaurant. Each occupied table had 2 people and we were given the least spacious table. And of course everyone else at the restaurant was not brown skinned like us. Felt discriminated. They gave us our entree before our appetizers even though we specifically asked for the appetizers first. If only the staff was good also 🤷🏽‍♀️
Salty and overpriced.  Authentic style doesn't make up for poor preparation.  Tried it 6-7 times before giving up.

We order from Grand Sichuan fairly often. We are big Chinese food aficionados. Last night we ordered spareribs,  Salt and pepper shrimp,  Crystal shrimp dumplings,  Cold sesame noodles,  eggplant in garlic sauce and Young Chow fried rice. Seriously one of the best meals I have ever had.
Amazing best restaurant in New York ever If u are hungry eat here really good food (wish it was open every day)
Affordable price,  a lot of options,  good foods

Still great: This isn't really a restaurant, it's a delivery place, but the food is superb. I don't know what some other reviewers are talking about. I order from GSH frequently, and the menu and preparation and really superior.

So awesome to have a legit Sichuan place in Bay Ridge! The Eggplant in Basil, Dan Dan noodles, Garlic Cucumbers, Braised fish w/ Napa Cabbage are all favorites and I could eat them every day! Service is always excellent and they are an awesome family business. Highly recommend for folks who love spicy food!
The best
Terrible quality chicken. Tastes like rubber. Avoid this place. Also, they say they open at 11, but the kitchen staff is not in until 12.
Excellent Sichuan. Just because you see soup dumplings on a menu, doesn't mean you should order them.
Poor service, staff is rude and the space looks sad
Whatever I ate there were delicious! I went about 4 times..

This was a cute family run restaurant. It was pretty busy when I was there but it didnt take long for me to get seated. The food was good but it took a while for it to come and they actually gave me another tables food. We had to ask several times to get our rice but when it came it was good. Portions r big so I would order one for 2 ppl next time.

Great for a big group bc of space, it wasn't crazy busy, and ordered family style. Very good veggie chow fun (had to order extra bc so good). Unreal green beans, ate even this wasn't veggie! It was worth the 7+ mile walk from bed stuy to bay ridge.
Seriously good food in a very simple environment. Almost only locals. And us
Good Chinese food.
(Translated by Google) Things are good  (Original) Все хорошо

Incredibly disappointing. Maybe it was a bad night or we ordered the wrong thing. Dan Dan noodles were sour, salty, and greasy not spicy at all; served room temperature. The cumin beef was dry and also room temperature to cold. Fiancé’s noodles had a sweet peanut taste, similar to peanut butter. Doubt I will try again. Look elsewhere.
The spicy Chendu dumplings were fine, but the General Tso's chicken was 80% filling and 20% chicken. Disappointed, and frankly not worth the price.
Good food
This is our favorite Sichuan place in Brooklyn.  If you are ordering off the “American Chinese” section, please don’t leave a review.  This place has awesome SICHUAN food.

Stand out, authentic Sichuan joint that is far afield of the city’s many ethnic Chinese agglomerations. Certainly among the better options across many cuisines for the neighborhood and potentially worth a trip from other parts of Brooklyn and Staten Island. The dining room is small but accommodating. Take out is a great choice. Please do yourself a favor and look beyond the American Chinese options on the lengthy menu and try the classic and New Sichuan choices.
If you are looking for Authentic Sichuan food in NY, this is the place. Hands down the best Chinese restaurent in NY!!
Not a bad Chinese joint
Love their fish dish. Not so much on their fried crabs, it would've been better if it was soft shell instead hard shell 🦀
Nothing bad but nothing amazing

Compared to most Chinese restaurants Grand Sichuan offers new and unique flavors including American and Chinese cuisine. And have a small and clean dining room for inside while also offering quick takeout and delivery. Assortment of dishes include vegetarian Meats and fish. Priced slightly higher than those flavorless Corner Chinese restaurants, the taste is very much worth it. It also has an economical lunch everyday good for those eating at the restaurant. You could tell it was very good when you see many Chinese customers. Grand Sichuan is very good food.
Everything here is great. We always get the Dan Dan Noodles and double cooked pork
Great food...authentic Szechuan can be had here!

Best restaurant in New York City!!! The food is simply addictive. I dream about those spicy peppercorn. Here is the go-to list:  Spicy Aromatic Soft Shell Crab Mung Bean Noodle Beef Tendon Shrimp Wonton in Hot Oil Jellyfish Mapo Tofu Lamb with Cumin Chicken with Three Peppers (not the actual name but they now what Im talking about)  God... Just thinking about this place now makes me so hungry!!
Best Chinese food anywhere.
Delicious "boil cook 🎏" and dan dan noodle.

Best Chinese in Brooklyn.  Some of it is quite spicy but it is possible to order more moderately spiced dishes too. Love the sweet and sour crispy fish which is vasy superior to any sweet and sour dish you've had before.  Also good: the dandan noodles, the pork and pickled cabbage soup, the smoked tea duck, and much more. We didn't like the hot pot but hot pot devotees may be fine. Be warned the  half-spicy hot pot is still pretty spicy.
If hot and spicy is what you want, hot and spicy you will get. Delicious and very reasonable for Bay Ridge. Recommend it to people who love authentic Sichuan cuisine.
The best Chinese food in NYC Period! Not kidding!

Excellent surprise surprise surprise a little golden nugget of authentic Chinese food in the waste land of Chinese take out in bay ridge . I recommend being adventurous at least with one dish . Nice people here
Gross. I was so excited for real Sichuan food ... this is not it. Half of it was cold, and the Dan Dan Mian was so sickeningly sugary I couldn't eat it.

The food was awful! A friend and I came here because we heard great things about this place. When we got there we were the only ones there. We places our order and the food came quick. Everything was under seasoned. The duck was cold. Everything lacked flavor. Really disappointed and won't be back.
Great authentic Chinese restaurant that will be challenging for some.  They have a large menu with both American Chinese and authentic dishes.  I love the fried rice, not overly greasy or salty.
This is a truly amazing place. I have been coming here non stop for 5 years. Try everything. Even the " regular " Chinese food is amazing.
Cheap, no frills, with an authentic menu.
Chili oil wontons are a must
(Translated by Google) The environment is comfortable and good.  (Original) 环境舒适，不错。
Great sichuan food.  Also general tso chicken was great too!
Great Sichuan food in an unassuming location.

(Translated by Google) 买 I bought a spicy chicken, a crisp cucumber, and a vinegar and a potato. I like it very much. I especially like potato chips. It’s so delicious! I love the food, it's delicious!  (Original) 👍👍 那天买了辣子鸡，脆口黄瓜，还有醋溜土豆丝儿，都很好吃，特别喜欢土豆丝 太好吃了！ I love the food, it's delicious!

Wonderful gem! Dan Dan noodles are excellent. Shrimp wantons in hot oil are divine. Spicy and aromatic fish stew is an orchestra of flavor new and delightful to the palate. One of the best restaurants in NY!

We like ordering from here though if we are looking for american chinese food, instead of Sichuan style, we also order from other places.  They're tops in authenic Sichuan style and that's not easy to find, but for american style fare they are just ok.
...good

We love this place.  Real sichuan cuisine is vibrant and exciting and a nice change of pace from the usual routine.  It might take some trial and error to find dishes that you like, but it's well worth it.  Right now we are into the Dan Dan Noodles, Guizhou Spicy Chicken, the Salt and Pepper Shrimp, Cumin Lamb, Sauteed Dry Bean Curd w/ Celery and Pork, Dry & Sauteed String Bean w/ Minced Pork...When we eat there we tend to get duck, fish, things that don't travel well for takeout.

I never got into Grand Sichuan but it's a very popular Chinese restaurant in the area. They have hot pot and they have a regular menu. I would go for the spicy things- dan dan noodles, spicy wontons, lamb, etc. Eat it with a lot of rice. Your mouth will be on fire.
best Chinese food in this area, get the cumin lamb or bbq ribs, or boneless spare ribs

This Grand Sichuan is different from the Grand Sichuan of Manhattan. It's Sichuan food and it is supposed to be spicy but it really isn't. But their style of cooking is very good and different from what you normally expect. I recommend the spicy wontons, dan dan noodles, beef with cumin, steamed fish... Anything not on the American menu!
